reviews.review_msg: Old ratings are inaccurate. Garth's aware this class sucks and makes sure no one is confused and gives time for students to ask questions. Only had to use excel where we were shown exactly what was expected on the hw. The final was the only hard part.

For a statistics prof, Garth is AMAZING! He genuinely wants u to understand the material and will explain any concept to u until it makes sense. Sara (TA) is always willing to make sure u do well on assignments. Overall, the course is a lot of information but they make it easier. CRIM320 was SO much easier than STATS 100 because of their teaching!

Garth really tries to support his students in every way he can, the TA is phenomenal especially if you need extra help in understanding. The course itself is what is hard, Garth has it structured it so you are equally graded on grade boosters such as short quizzes and assignments rather than just weighted on exams

Super chill guy, do not read the old reviews, he is so cool and genuinely fun to listen to. Amazing lectures and clear guidelines for everything. If you put in the bare minimum amount of work, you will still get a really good grade.

Finishing the CRIM 320 final exam, being the last exam of your entire degree feels like this:
*Frodo gazing out into Mordor with tears in his eyes* - "Its done".
*Sam turns to look at Frodo* - "Yes, Mr. Frodo, its over now".
If you take this class online you get to see pre recorded lectures from 2017 in which Garth hard beefs with an Asian kid all semester long. It's so funny makes up for how boring the class is.

Every crim major fears 320 but 321 was way worse IMO. I took this class as distance ed, and we watched pre recorded lecture material from 2017. Midterm was hard and they expected a lot but to be fair Garth does warn you. As long as you watch the lectures and labs you should get a B at least. Garth is super funny and has old school mentality.

Not sure why this class has such a bad rep, its not nearly as bad as CRIM 321, perhaps someone got confused between the two when they started the fear bandwagon. Last semester before graduating and this is probably the only class I've taken where I feel like what I am learning is a job-ready skill. Its not terrible but you have to put in the work.

Four weeks in and I would rather walk 8 miles barefoot on lego bricks than have to take this class again.  Do NOT take this class remotely. It is a stats class and you WILL have questions or need help; if you need help you have to send the TA an email and wait 2-3 business days for a vague response that doesn't answer your question. I'm lovin' it!

It is a tough course and exams are heavy for sure but Garth is always trying to be there to help you to succeed. He answers every question in class to make sure everyone is on track and he replies to emails frequently with clear instructions. Always be patient. It is absolutely worth taking classes with him.

Exams are tough for sure but hes an awesome lecturer! Super engaging, explains content well, and always happy to answer even the most basic questions multiple times. Take labs with Sara if shes one of the TAs, shes great as well!

PT. 1 okay, lets start by saying he yelled at our class for getting an average of 55%. Okay, understatement, HE YELLED AT US, LIKE MY DAD YELLED AT ME WHEN I WAS 5. "ITS IRONIC YOU GUYS ARE TALKING RIGHT NOW" referring to out midterm marks (Garth, lecture on October 24). He blamed us for the bad midterm, but they took off petty marks.
Hes super rude which he think probably thinks comes off as powerful but it is truly just unprofessional.

I'm not strong in stats AT ALL. I failed the first midterm, and was doing borderline in the class. Got a tutor, and saw him to discuss my options well before the 2nd midterm. When he says to do this, DO IT. Garth cares and IF YOU ARE WILLING TO PUT THE EFFORT IN, he'll help you. Plus, he usually has awesome socks which helps with his rude attitude

Great professor and awesome human being. A couple of semesters ago had a family tragedy and Garth supported and accommodated my situation. Overally very interesting to listen to, if you like Garth then also take Terrorism with him, his knowledge blew me away. He is the reason I decided to major in Criminology.

Garth was an amazing prof that makes lectures more bearable and interesting thanks to his funny sense of humor. Without his humor and knowledge, the class would be much harder. However, be prepared to put in the work because there are a lot of homework and the exams are not easy and this is one of the hardest classes in Crim so don't slack off.

(pt. 3) honestly taken a huge toll on me but by Garth giving me the chance to finish up this exam prompted me to turn around his reviews because in my opinion, the character of a professor really means a lot in the long run.

This class is already so hard specially for us crim students with limited stats knowledge and skills. He makes it harder by grading tough and placing a high emphasis on exams that half the class will fail. This class literally made me reconsider my degree. It was so damn hard and stressful.

Makes an already tough topic for most even tougher with tough grading. You will think you're doing well based on his in-class examples and tutorial homework but come the midterm and final, you will get destroyed. Do not take this class with him expecting to get anywhere near half-decent grades.

2nd class I have taken with Garth and same results. I got a B- the course is diffcuilt but he makes sure everyone understands. If you don't go to his office hours and he will help you. Ya hes loud and arrogant in class but hey the guy knows how to teach and help students and I respect that. He expects you to be a student hes old school!

Explained concepts well and would go over until it was understood. HOWEVER: extremely arrogant, condescending, complained about his job to students every lecture. Made class extremely uncomfortable, got very angry when students emailed him or asked questions outside of class. Ridiculed students in front of entire class for asking a simple question.

Took this class at Harbour Center with a group of about 30 students. You'll come to realize that he's a good prof that tries to help you understand those concepts. He cared more and was more pleasant in this small class. Forget the text, and study from lecture notes.

garth is a condescending, unhelpful prof. he hates it when students e-mail him and responses back with harsh answers. extremely hard exams, assignments and on the spot quizzes. this class will leave you stressed out and worried. very little help, sympathy and understanding from garth and the TAs. terribly laid out course structure. NOT RECOMMENDED

Garth is clear in his concepts. I wish he was more clear with regards to exam expectations. So much writing and you must know every single detail! This isn't an easy class and Garth tries to make it interesting, so there is that.

A difficult prof yes, but not to the point where one cannot pass with a descent grade. Exams were al written and very difficult to follow at times. Other than that Garth is great, this would be the second time I have taken him, never disappoints during lectures. Be ready to read and memorize online readings.

Has strangest rule that any teacher can employ..not to talk to him at the beginning/break/end of class, yet when he tries to explain statistics (which is tough) he recommends that you see him during his office hours. Which never has appts. Exams are tough, no MC, all written and ridiculous Q's. Class average midterm: 51%. Take at your own risk.

Love that Garth will actually take the time to go over a concept as many times as needed until everyone understands it. He is intimidating at first, and won't treat you like you are in highschool. He treats everyone as an adult and expects that you work hard. Take his criticisms constructively and you will do well.

May seem intimidating at first but one of the best profs i have had. Drills the concept into your head and makes sure everyone understands before he moves on. Study his lecture notes inside out pay attention during lectures and you will know what is on the exam. The TA Rebecca is very helpful as well.

Intimidating at first, but really wants his students to understand. Very clear and straightforward. Fair marker. Loved that we did not have to do a research paper. SPSS was pretty easy if you went to tutorial. I liked his class, I don't know why people freak out so much.

I was worried about the class because of all the reviews here.  But he's a really good prof and always trying to clarify things. If you don't ask for clarification he can't help you.  He gives you hints to what will be on the exams. The TA, Rebecca, is really good and is also helpful in clarifying things.

Theres always the one person who thinks they want to be the teachers pet!! This class will leave you stressed and confused!! Be prepared to hire a tutor, without one you will FAIL this class!!! Be warned, exams are brutal!!

Do not take this class with Garth. This class is very difficult and SPSS doesn't make it any better. This class will leave you paranoid and sweating until the final exam. Class material is taught in a way to make it more difficult than it actually is. You will definitely need a tutor for this class. People in the class are annoying to top it off.
2 words: WACK JOB!

Worst class ever, Hardest exam. lowest average. No consideration about how the over all marks were distributed. He basically has pride in making this a hard class that the majority of people will not get a good grade it.

Garth made the class as painless as possible. He's excellent at clarifying confusions, but you've got to be willing to ask questions. TAs weren't as useful as they could have been as the tutorial and lectures were completely unrelated. All exams purely based on lectures and there's no text for lecture material. Overall, okay class if you try.

The best lecturer/teacher I've ever had! He is attentive, genuinely cares for his students, accommodating, smart, and helpful.  He explains things until they are crystal clear in layman's terms.  However, the structure of the course was horrific; there was very little guidance.  Also TAs were useless and not helpful.

lectures were very organized. however, lectures, text, tutorial and assignments all seemed as if they weren't related. the assignments were unclear and took a long time to do for a mere 3-4% each. exams were pretty tough; be forewarned! garth seems like a great guy, but the class was horrid! guess thats what happens with its a required course.

Garth is absolutely awesome! made a tough/boring course extremely fun and easy to understand. makes the course practical by giving you tools. his exams are extremely fair b/c all the material is given to you in lecture; you don't need to read...just memorize and understand concepts. i absolutely love him!! really down-to-earth and approachable.

it's a stats course, what can u expect? he tries his best to make things super clear, he's always full of energy, and actually keeps me awake through the lec. if i were given a choice to take this course again, i would pick him over patric L. he's much better in terms of learning

Does his best to explain everything as comprehensively as possible. Is willing to answer any questions. Quite a lot of work for this class, but he makes sure you learn the material. Midterm was very fair. Paper wasn't bad once the ball's rolling. He's a pretty decent prof if you don't take things too defensively.

The course content is diffcult but he explains it wonderfuly- going through things step by step and anything important he repeats it. The midterm was more than fair- it was exactly what he said was on it (and no he isn't one of those profs who just reads out the title of every chapter and says that is what is on the test)
Best looking prof i've ever had! His good-looks and sense of humour are what keeps me awake in a class I'm forced to take.
made class fun, interesting, great at explaining concepts/ material, very fair, I really enjoyed the class!!!
No Comments
avoid this guy. he makes the class harder than it should be. he was a waste of my money.

Garth is one of my favourite prof's. His lectures are amazingly clear and he is one of the funniest prof's I have ever had! He is super cool outside of class too, and if you ever need help he is always there!
No Comments

Garth is very knowlegable and intelligent. His teaching methods and organization are his undoing. I have heard many comments in support of Garth in different classes, but avoid taking a research method class with Garth unless you are satisfied with receiving lower marks than you would with a different professor.

Garth has no ability to teach.  He is unable to pass along his knowledge of a subject to his students.  If you do not understand something, you will not get the help needed.  His lectures are disorganized and he tests you on things not taught in lecture or tutorial.  This course is mandatory but do not take it with Garth unless you want to fail.
He is always willing to take time out of his day, and stay extra office hours (even during his wife's pregnancy) to help out his students.

I have had him for both Crim 320 and 321. He makes you work, but he explains things and is willing to help you out. You just have to be willing to work, and suprise, you actually might learn something
insensitive to students' need, good researcher but not good prof.

Davies is an arrogant little man who enjoys to belittle his class and does not seem like he genuinely wants to help his students learn the material. Perhaps it is just the course itself but most students didn't like him either!

AMAZING Professor! She will spent a tonne of time helping you, if you want it. She actually cares about students & is super passionate. Rare to find profs like this & definitely recommend taking her class!

320 is simply not a fun class to take or teach. Patrick is a good prof with lots of research experience. The downside was that he did not post slides which resulted in a tonne of note writing. The tutorials were essential in order to understand SPSS and the assignments. The research proposal wasn't too bad, but the final was tough to say the least.

It's a shame he gets bad ratings b/c of a bad course.  Yes the course is stats and its not fun. But he is a very smart man and a very funny guy as well!  To the person below:  if you are writing everything on each slide, that's a problem.  You need to be able to pick out the key points on each slide that's the trick! Overall, a good prof!
I don't know why everyone says Lussier is hot...he's not, and does that really matter? He is an okay prof but a bit confusing at times

reality is its crim320.. no one wants to teach it. Test are straight forward and fair, midterm is straight out of the book.. for the final i highly recommend both you and your partners do the SPSS interpretations of the findings for your assignments. since 75% of the final is just doing that. its stats... lectures notes i recommended laptop. GL

Overall, great prof considering he teaches reseach methods. His midterm was fair, and i must say the final was tedious. I liked how he at least tried to make a class everyone dreads somewhat interesting.
Excellent teacher who tries very hard with somewhat dry material. Makes class interesting.
No Comments
Nice eye candy...but he knows he is hot! As for the class he tried but spent too much time asking questions from an non participating audience. He knows the subject but can't get the point across

Nice enough guy, but lectures were unbearable, considering that its a stats class. I think he tries, but has a hard time getting his point across. However, this class could have been much worse. Exams are not too hard, nor are the assignments. He is willing to help his students.

Totally in agreement that he wastes time, asks many confusing questions and waits forever for someone to give the exact answer he wants. workload is managable though and he has a cute accent and is not bad to look at. Very much aware of his hotness however, and dresses like a gap model...ew.

Ok...good looking guy but soooo spacey! He spends literally the entire lecture asking us questions and trying to get us to answer them. Just give us the answers and move on! He is pretty cute, but he should try getting through the material rather than rambling forever!
He is very arrogant, and does not attend his own office hours. I will never take a class with him again

Don't need the textbook, and don't need to attend lectures.  The research project was actually a lot of fun, because you get to chose your topic.   Went to class a handful of times, worked moderately hard on my paper, and got a B-.   Just print off all the lecture slides and study them, and you'll pass and get a good mark.
Ted Palys is one of the most helpful instructors that I have ever had. Cares about his students and wants them to do well! Fair assignments and exams
Ted is as laid-back a prof as you could hope for, which is good, because research is an anal discipline

Rambles forever, horrible marker, marked my project incorrectly, and i don't think he fixed it.  Lastly, he bombed people on the final, and refused to let them see it.  So I think he did that to scale the marks.
Don't ever get sick because he won't care: dropping his class or extensions are a nightmare.
No Comments

Nice guy but terrible prof, don't even bother going to lecture total waste of time. The organization level is terrible was late to class everyday. Even the ta got frustrated with he lack of interest in teaching
He is apprachable and flexible, but otherwise an average prof
He may be a horrible prof but he makes us laugh!!!!
He is not a good teacher! He does not even attempt to guide you through this difficult course. Would not recommend!!
Brian is a babe who rocks hard! He made 320 fun, no seriously. His teaching style is amazing, and his no bs style is refreshing.

This class was nuts. Bryan did his best to make it better but it was not an easy task. Why is everybody blaming Bryan for not being helpful or clear? The tutorials were useless.Scott Brody can type fast and that's it.Never explained how to interpret the concepts or how to better aproach this subject. He just scared us good!

boring course material and lectures are not that helpful but he's funny & nice. his exams are not difficult. he's helpful and he responds to email fairly quickly. relatively easy compared to other profs who teach this course.

material was difficult, but he did not really lecture much in class...i was always asked myself 'Why did i even come' because everything was usually off topic.  Even so, a nice prof, who does what he can do dumb everything down so we do better.

The material in this course is brutal, although that's not Bryan's fault. The material is painfully boring and can get real confusing. Bryan was really helpful during office hours. I'm glad I'll be never taking this course, or another research course, ever again.

Really funny guy.  Unfortunately, might be better comedy writer than a "teacher" slash professor.  Learned little to nothing during lectures, which were excruciatingly boring, with the exception of Kinney's wry wit.  This class is brutal, regardless of who teaches it.

Man, I thought that I would never get through this course back in the day. I don't know if Bryan is still teaching or not, he was a decent prof. I felt for him when he had to teach this course because this course seriously blew goats.
